intro: Amyris serratifolia, commonly known as the serrated amyris, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It features narrow, lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its bark is aromatic and has been used traditionally in herbal medicine. Amyris serratifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and distinctive scent.
